About Us | The Kane | Stuart, FL top of page Message Us 772-223-7807 Home Weddings Special Events Calendar About Us Dimensions Contact Mais... Use tab to navigate through the menu items. About Us By hosting your event at The Kane, you are supporting the Council on Aging of Martin County! The Kane Center is the home of the Council on Aging of Martin County - a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization that has served our area's seniors since 1974. The Council's mission is to be the unparalleled resource of expertise, programming and support for seniors in Martin County. Its vision is to inspire a community that embraces, uplifts and encourages seniors to maintain lives of quality and purpose. ​ Proceeds from event rentals at The Kane support the Council's many services, including Meals on Wheels, the Adult Day Club, case management, nutrition counseling, senior services navigation, and caregiver counseling and support. The Council is the longest-standing organization in the county dedicated to serving our senior population. ​ Named for a local couple who have championed senior issues for decades, the $15 million center was developed through a public/philanthropic partnership, including $5.8 million from public funds, the Florida Legislature and a grant from the Florida Department of Elder Affairs. Learn More (772) 223-7807 thekane@kanecenter.org 900 SE Salerno Rd Stuart, FL 34997 ​ Privacy Policy bottom of page

Volunteer Login Become a Member About Who We Are The Kane Center Our Team News Join Our Mailing List Contact Us Careers Kane Corporate Partners Programs Meals on Wheels Adult Day Club Memory Enhancement Care Management Day Primary Care Caregiver Resources Kane Cuisine Nutrition Counseling Martin County HUGS CMS Guide Program Center Membership Healthy Living Entertainment Special Events Live Entertainment Classes Fitness Technology Art Dance Brain Fitness Foreign Languages Lectures & Workshops Games and Groups Free Expertise Events Poinsettia Power Sage Awards Sage Awards Gallery Event Calendar Volunteer Donate Volunteer Volunteering Together, Anything is Possible. Are you looking for an opportunity to make a real difference in our community? Then there is a place for YOU at the Kane Center! We would not be able to provide our wide array of programs and services without the generosity, kindness and talents of our volunteers. Currently, We're not accepting any new volunteers at this time. Join Us Today! Every day, our volunteers improve the lives of elders by delivering Meals on Wheels , getting involved in the Adult Day Club activities, serving food or serving as a cashier in the Bistro, fundraising, or helping out in many other ways with clerical and other expertise. Download our Volunteer Application or stop in at the Kane Center to fill one out in person. Return your application to the front desk at the Kane Center or mail it to the address below. We will contact you once your information is received. Currently, We're not accepting any new volunteers at this time . Council on Aging Martin County, Inc. 900 SE Salerno Road Stuart, FL  34997 Volunteer Opportunities Adult Day Club The Adult Day Club provides a safe, nurturing environment with medical supervision for seniors who benefit from Club services, exercises and other activities. Volunteers can serve food or help with activities and crafts. We also welcome musical performers or others who can entertain our Club members. Meals on Wheels Monday through Friday, our volunteers deliver hot, nutritious meals to homebound elders through our Meals on Wheels program. These volunteers can sometimes be the only friendly face a lonely senior will see during the day and are a valuable resource for making sure an older person living alone is OK. Training takes just 30 to 45 minutes and can be scheduled at your convenience. Assigned routes are convenient to your home or businesses, or you can request a specific route. Volunteering with Meals on Wheels takes just two hours each week. You can share a route with someone, or your school, business or organization can adopt a route to share. If you can't commit to a fixed schedule, we need "on call” volunteers to fill in for regulars who might be away for a few days or weeks. Volunteers use their own vehicles to pick up the meals at distribution sites, then deliver them between 10:30 a.m. and 12:30 p.m. You'll need: A valid driver's license and an insured vehicle. A completed Meals on Wheels volunteer application. Two clean coolers to transport the meals. You will complete training prior to making your first delivery. We can arrange for you to team up at first to become acquainted with your Meals on Wheels clients. Clerical Volunteers are routinely needed in the Council on Aging office to answer phones, file and help with fundraising and newsletter mailings.  With over 6,500 newsletters distributed regularly, this is no small task! Our gang of "Super Stuffers” is on call to help the Development Department assemble mass mailings and prepare them for distribution by the Post Office.  But it’s not all hard work.  On mailing days, our volunteer crew members enjoy coffee, doughnuts and socializing.  Their good deeds are also good fun! Fundraising As with any non-profit organization, the Council on Aging relies on the generosity of private donors to help us fulfill our mission of providing professional and compassionate care to seniors in Martin County. To help raise money and awareness for the Council, we hold a variety of special events throughout the year, such as a fashion show and our annual Sage Awards.  Our fund raising volunteers act as support staff in organizing these events.  They work closely with our Development Department to ensure that vital programs such as Meals on Wheels, adult day care and more are available to the seniors who need them.  It’s a fun and fulfilling way to volunteer! Bistro The Kane Center Bistro offers a tasty array of snacks, beverages and lunch selections.  We rely entirely on volunteers to staff the Bistro. Duties include running the cash register, helping customers select their refreshments, and serving items such as soup and crock pot meals. Town Center Help us make the Kane Center a welcoming place for all. Greet and direct visitors. Sell tickets to upcoming shows and events. Provide visitors general information about our programs and services and conduct Kane Center tours. Enjoy Life. Be Well. Stay Active. Find it all at the Kane Center. There's a lot happening at the Kane Center, and you won't want to miss a minute of it! Our year-round activity schedule features classes, clubs, concerts, special events and more. All programs are designed for active seniors age 55 or better – with family and friends welcome to join in. While you don't need to be a member to enjoy Kane Center activities, becoming a member has its perks! Kane members receive discounts on everything from classes and concert tickets to purchases at the Kane Bistro.  Once ordered, membership cards will be mailed within 5 business days. For questions about membership, please call 772.223.7800. Comprehensive services from the Kane Center were made possible by an additional $150,000 contribution by the Joseph C. Day Foundation , which represents part of a total commitment of $500,000 to support the Council on Aging of Martin County. Kane Member Your single annual membership to the Kane Center includes the following benefits: Discount on all fitness classes One free fitness class per year Access to counseling services with a licensed clinical social worker Free Healthly Living lectures Discounts on most Kane live entertainment & special events Discounts on Lifelong Learning and workshops Unlimited participation in Kane Games & Groups Free Education lectures Day Trips to historical sites and other places of interest Access to free member events 10% discount on Kane Center venue rental (discount on room fee only) 5 free Kane Cuisine meals (can be donated to seniors in need) Duration: 1 year Price: $60.00 Sign Up The Charles & Rae Kane Center, 900 SE Salerno Road, Stuart, FL 34997 Email: Kanecenter@coamartin.org Phone: (772) 223-7800 Quick Links Home About The Kane Center Contact Us Purchasing & Privacy Policy Poinsettia Power Sponsorship Poinsettia Power Silent Auction Area Agency on Aging © 2024 Council on Aging Martin County. Who We Are Login Become a Member About Who We Are The Kane Center Our Team News Join Our Mailing List Contact Us Careers Kane Corporate Partners Programs Meals on Wheels Adult Day Club Memory Enhancement Care Management Day Primary Care Caregiver Resources Kane Cuisine Nutrition Counseling Martin County HUGS CMS Guide Program Center Membership Healthy Living Entertainment Special Events Live Entertainment Classes Fitness Technology Art Dance Brain Fitness Foreign Languages Lectures & Workshops Games and Groups Free Expertise Events Poinsettia Power Sage Awards Sage Awards Gallery Event Calendar Volunteer Donate Who We Are Who We Are At the Council on Aging of Martin County, we believe that everyone should have the opportunity to live life to the fullest – no matter their age. We were founded as a private, 501(c)(3) organization in 1974 to provide services tailored to the specific needs of seniors. More than 50 years later, we are the longest-serving senior services agency in the county offering the most comprehensive resources for elders, their families and their caregivers. Our Mission and Vision Our mission is to be the unparalleled resource of expertise, programming and support for seniors in Martin County. Our vision is to inspire a community that embraces, uplifts and encourages seniors to maintain lives of quality and purpose. We provide programs in support of this mission, including Meals on Wheels;  an adult day program; senior-focused primary medical care; care management; caregiver support; and a robust offering of educational, cultural and wellness programs specifically designed for seniors. Our History More than 40 years ago, several concerned Martin County residents put a small ad in the local newspaper, announcing a meeting to discuss forming an organization to help seniors in need. Over 200 people packed the tiny meeting hall. Their consensus regarding the needs of the elder community: feed the homebound, transport the frail and disabled, and cut through the red tape seniors and their families face when trying to find assistance. The consensus of needs in the community and commitment to meet those needs resulted in the formation of the Council on Aging, which was incorporated in 1974. Since its founding, the Council on Aging of Martin County has consistently grown and excelled in the senior service area. 1974 Our Founding The Council on Aging of Martin County founded. 1974 1976 Meals on Wheels The Council launches the first Meals on Wheels program in Martin County, delivering 20 meals daily. Today, over 250 meals are delivered Monday through Friday county-wide. Nutritional services have also been expanded to include Senior Dining Centers and monthly grocery options. 1979 Lead Agency The Council is designated as "Lead Agency” for Martin County under the Community Care for the Elderly Act. 1979 1987 First Adult Day Care Center The Council creates the first licensed adult day care center in Martin County, which has grown from 12 seniors per day to the capacity to serve 90 seniors per day. 2003 Prestigious Award The Council's Nutrition Services/Meals on Wheels program is awarded National Certification through the Meals on Wheels Association of America. The program is one of only four in the state of Florida and 46 nationwide to earn this recognition. 2003 2006 Initial Funding for Kane Center The Council receives a $5 million appropriation from the State of Florida to be used toward the creation of a state-of-the-art, multi-purpose senior center, kicking off a $15 million public/private capital campaign to build the Charles and Rae Kane Senior Center. May 2011 Moving Day The Council officially moves its operations to the Kane Center, which opens its doors in May 2011. May 2011 February 2012 Kane Clinic Open for Business The Kane Clinic begins operation in the Kane Center, offering primary geriatric specialty medical care in a medical environment designed to address the multiple health care needs of the elderly. April 2012 Cooks in the Kitchen For the first time in its history, the Council begins to produce Meals on Wheels in-house, in its state-of-the-art commercial kitchen.  Meals are distributed immediately after preparation, using fresh ingredients, freshly prepared. April 2012 September 2012 Health Care Champions Award The Kane Clinic is recognized by Scripps Treasure Coast Newspapers, winning a Health Care Champions Award for Innovation in Health Care. February 2016 First Annual Sage Awards The Council holds the first annual Sage Awards, the first and only awards ceremony honoring the wisdom and worth of our area's seniors, recognizing their contributions to the world in which we live. February 2016 April 2017 Joseph C. & Ann S. Day Medical Center Open The state-of-the-art Joseph C. & Ann S. Day Medical Center opens at the Kane Center. Poinsettia Power Login Become a Member About Who We Are The Kane Center Our Team News Join Our Mailing List Contact Us Careers Kane Corporate Partners Programs Meals on Wheels Adult Day Club Memory Enhancement Care Management Day Primary Care Caregiver Resources Kane Cuisine Nutrition Counseling Martin County HUGS CMS Guide Program Center Membership Healthy Living Entertainment Special Events Live Entertainment Classes Fitness Technology Art Dance Brain Fitness Foreign Languages Lectures & Workshops Games and Groups Free Expertise Events Poinsettia Power Sage Awards Sage Awards Gallery Event Calendar Volunteer Donate Holiday Bazaar, Luncheon and Fashion Show When: Tuesday, Dec 2, 2025 10:00 am to 2:30pm Where: Hutchinson Shores Resort & Spa 3793 NE Ocean Blvd, Jensen Beach FL 34957 Click To Buy Tickets To Benefit Meals on Wheels Demand for our Meals on Wheels program, the only one in Martin County, has exploded since before the pandemic. Costs are continuing to increase and our staff and volunteers are working tirelessly to prepare, package and deliver more than 500 hot, healthy meals, each weekday, to the seniors who most need them. Funds raised by Poinsettia Power help ensure that the seniors on the waiting list for government-funded meals do not have to wait, hungry and alone. You Can Make a Difference in the Lives of Seniors! Check out our business Sponsorship Opportunities! Sponsorships are still Available! Become A Sponsor Please be aware that grants from a DAF or QCD gifts from your IRA, have federal restrictions on how the funds can be used, including restrictions on event tickets, prize drawings and items won at auctions. If sponsorship payment is coming from a DAF or QCD, event tickets will not be included with the sponsorship. We recommend consulting with your tax attorney concerning associated “quid pro quo” benefit. For more information or to secure your sponsorship, please contact; Michele Jacobs at mjacobs@kanecenter.org or 772.223.7803. I’d Like to Donate a Silent Auction Basket! Thank You to Our Top Sponsors! Help Us Fight Senior Hunger and Isolation. We can’t wait to hear the hustle and bustle of the holiday spirit as it fills the Town Center at the Kane Center with holiday vendors and happy shoppers picking up gifts for friends, family, and of course something for ourselves. Today, the Meals on Wheels program prepares and packages an average of 500 meals daily, delivered by over 200 loyal and dedicated Meals on Wheels volunteers. All proceeds from Poinsettia Power benefit Meals on Wheels, our flagship program, which has been serving Martin County's seniors for 48 years. We hope we can count on your support this year to help Meals on Wheels continue to provide this life-saving safety net service. We can’t do it without You! Your gift means the world to our seniors: Too weak or unsteady to safely cook When the choice is between medicine and food When both spouse and caregiver are infirmed When a senior is homebound, ill, or frail For many of these vulnerable seniors, our volunteer may be the only person they see on a given day. Having someone who cares helps reduce feelings of isolation and loneliness. Thank you for helping ensure our seniors remain healthy, safe, and connected to a supportive community. Find it all at at the Kane Center View Membership Plans Slide 3 Adult Day Club Martin County's premier adult day program and memory enhancement center Learn More Slide 4 Meals On Wheels Meals on Wheels program provides hot, noontime meals for those who are unable to shop or cook. Learn More Slide 4 URGENT SCAM ALERT!! We want to make you aware of a scam that's targeting members of our community, particularly our seniors. Fraudulent callers are spoofing our phone numbers to make it look like they are from the Council on Aging Martin County, the Kane Center, Day Primary Care, as well as other local organizations. They are asking for immediate payments or financial information. Learn More Emergency Hurricane Jump Kits – Click for details & purchase Your Hub for Senior Resources We're Celebrating 50 Years, five decades of serving seniors and their families in Martin County. Day Medical Center offers primary medical care for adults, with a focus on spending quality, one-on-one time with each patient. We also provide Care Management to help seniors live independently for as long as possible by providing access to quality care and assistance with the activities of daily living. Whether you are looking for a place to have fun, get fit, meet new friends, learn a new skill, see great live entertainment, or all of the above. The Kane Center is the place to be! Our goal is to help our community stay healthy, be active, eat well and get help. Access the services you need, get the respite care you deserve, and improve the quality of life that you spend with your loved one. The Integrative Memory Enhancement Program (IMEP) is a dynamic and highly effective, research-based therapeutic program for individuals experiencing early memory loss. A delicious dining option that brings the flavor, convenience, and quality of restaurant food right to your door. With Kane Cuisine & Meals On Wheels, you’ll enjoy professionally prepared meals delivered fresh. Meals are delivered Monday through Friday, between 10:30 a.m. and 12:30 p.m. Make a difference today. Make a difference tomorrow. There are many ways to give! Donate Today! Share Your Story! Remembering Kathryn Spencer It is with heavy hearts that we announce the passing of Kathryn (Kate) Spencer, a dedicated member of our Board of Directors. Kate started volunteering with us as an active member of the Finance Committee in 2014. In October 2016, she was elected to the Board of Directors. A year later, she was elected to serve as an Officer, which in the capacity of Treasurer, she also assumed the position of Chair of the Finance Committee. Displaying her innate leadership skills and commitment to the organization, Kate was elected as Board Chair in 2018 and served in that position until 2021, followed by assuming the post of Immediate Past Chair for three additional years. Kate continued to serve as a member of the Board of Directors for the Council on Aging of Martin County (COA) until her passing on March 11, 2025. Kate was the epitome of a volunteer leader. Her governance was always marked by her camaraderie amongst Board and Committee members, as well as staff. She didn’t just attend meetings or lend her name to a cause, she constantly introduced new candidates to the Finance Committee and the Board of Directors, ensuring that fresh voices and ideas had a platform to help shape the COA initiatives. Kate shared her talents and resources, going above and beyond in support of the COA’s work. Her contributions were not just about what she gave, but the way she gave it – with an open heart and a spirit of collaboration. Kate displayed a genuine interest in the well-being of others. During her association with the COA, Kate never hesitated to give of her time and energy for the greater good. Her commitment to senior issues was clear not only through her presence at the many COA functions and fund-raising events that she attended, but through her true advocacy for seniors. Kate also had the distinctive ability to flawlessly engage, guide and inspire others to join her in the COA’s mission to serve seniors in our community. Kate embodied the values of commitment and compassion. She was a guiding light for all of us, and her legacy will continue to inspire and influence the work of the Council on Aging of Martin County for years to come. We are deeply grateful for the time, energy, support, and love she dedicated to our cause. Kathryn (Kate) Spencer will always be remembered as a cornerstone of our efforts and an invaluable member of our community. Join Our Team! We invite you to explore our available career opportunities, then apply online for the position that best suits your interests and qualifications. We look forward to learning more about you—thank you for expressing your interest in the Council on Aging of Martin County. Learn More And View Openings! We were founded as a private, 501(c)(3) organization in 1974 to provide services tailored to the specific needs of seniors. More than 40 years later, we are the longest-serving senior services agency in the county offering the most comprehensive resources for elders, their families and their caregivers. At the Forefront of "Aging Well" The Kane Center is the home of the Council on Aging of Martin County. The Kane Center is specially designed for seniors of all capabilities and walks of life – as well as their families and caregivers – to come together in a secure, comfortable atmosphere where they truly feel at home. Each member of our staff serves a special purpose, making valuable contributions to the success of our organization every single day. By joining our team, you will be fulfilling our mission of being ‘the unparalleled resource of expertise, programming and support for seniors in Martin County.’ We all want to feel good about where we work, and we all want to see the results of our work have a lasting impact. Here at The Council on Aging of Martin County, you will be doing just that!” What We Have to Offer Our benefits package for all full-time team members include: Paid Time Off Comprehensive Medical Insurance Dental Insurance Vision Insurance Extended Illness Bank Discounts on Kane Center Entertainment Performance Based Compensation Employer-Paid Life Insurance Employee Assistance Program 403(b) Savings Plan with Employer Match Recognition Events Kane Bistro for On-site Meals Current Job Opportunities We invite you to explore our available career opportunities, then apply online for the position that best suits your interests and qualifications. We look forward to learning more about you—thank you for expressing your interest in the Council on Aging of Martin County. Click Here to Request Application EEOC Statement The Council on Aging of Martin County is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Our organization fosters an inclusive and diverse workplace. CMS Guide Program Login Become a Member About Who We Are The Kane Center Our Team News Join Our Mailing List Contact Us Careers Kane Corporate Partners Programs Meals on Wheels Adult Day Club Memory Enhancement Care Management Day Primary Care Caregiver Resources Kane Cuisine Nutrition Counseling Martin County HUGS CMS Guide Program Center Membership Healthy Living Entertainment Special Events Live Entertainment Classes Fitness Technology Art Dance Brain Fitness Foreign Languages Lectures & Workshops Games and Groups Free Expertise Events Poinsettia Power Sage Awards Sage Awards Gallery Event Calendar Volunteer Donate CMS Guide Program The CMS GUIDE Program Offered by the Council on Aging Martin County, provides comprehensive support and resources to those with dementia and caregivers in our community. The GUIDE program is open to any patient with dementia who has Medicare as primary insurance (not advantage or supplemental plans). This program is free to patients offers a variety of services, including: Caregiver Education and Training : Learn essential skills to manage caregiving responsibilities effectively. Counseling and Support : Receive emotional support and guidance from trained professionals. Information and Resources : Access valuable information on topics such as healthcare, legal matters, and financial planning. Free Respite Services For those who qualify, the CMS GUIDE Program offers free respite services to provide caregivers with a much-needed break. These services can include adult day care, in-home care, or other temporary assistance. Learn More To find out if you qualify for the CMS GUIDE Program and to receive additional information, please contact Kelley Pekarsky at 561-320-7451 The Charles & Rae Kane Center, 900 SE Salerno Road, Stuart, FL 34997 Email: Kanecenter@coamartin.org Phone: (772) 223-7800 Quick Links Home About The Kane Center Contact Us Purchasing & Privacy Policy Poinsettia Power Sponsorship Poinsettia Power Silent Auction Area Agency on Aging © 2024 Council on Aging Martin County. Kane Corporate Partners Login Become a Member About Who We Are The Kane Center Our Team News Join Our Mailing List Contact Us Careers Kane Corporate Partners Programs Meals on Wheels Adult Day Club Memory Enhancement Care Management Day Primary Care Caregiver Resources Kane Cuisine Nutrition Counseling Martin County HUGS CMS Guide Program Center Membership Healthy Living Entertainment Special Events Live Entertainment Classes Fitness Technology Art Dance Brain Fitness Foreign Languages Lectures & Workshops Games and Groups Free Expertise Events Poinsettia Power Sage Awards Sage Awards Gallery Event Calendar Volunteer Donate Kane Corporate Partners Kane Corporate Partners The Kane Corporate Partnership Program gives businesses the opportunity to invest in best-in-class programming for seniors. Through our Corporate Partnerships, we are able to offer high-quality live entertainment, free world-class caregiver education, dynamic educational lecture series, free monthly movies, produce fundraising events that support our charitable programs for frail seniors, and much more. In short, we could not offer the wide array of programs at the Kane Center without the support of our Corporate Partners. Contact us to learn more about this exciting program! Membership Login Become a Member About Who We Are The Kane Center Our Team News Join Our Mailing List Contact Us Careers Kane Corporate Partners Programs Meals on Wheels Adult Day Club Memory Enhancement Care Management Day Primary Care Caregiver Resources Kane Cuisine Nutrition Counseling Martin County HUGS CMS Guide Program Center Membership Healthy Living Entertainment Special Events Live Entertainment Classes Fitness Technology Art Dance Brain Fitness Foreign Languages Lectures & Workshops Games and Groups Free Expertise Events Poinsettia Power Sage Awards Sage Awards Gallery Event Calendar Volunteer Donate Become a Member Don't Miss A Minute! Enjoy Life. Be Well. Stay Active. Find it all at the Kane Center. There's a lot happening at the Kane Center, and you won't want to miss a minute of it! Our year-round activity schedule features classes, clubs, concerts, special events and more. All programs are designed for active seniors age 55 or better – with family and friends welcome to join in. While you don't need to be a member to enjoy Kane Center activities, becoming a member has its perks! Kane members receive discounts on everything from classes and concert tickets to purchases at the Kane Bistro.  Once ordered, membership cards will be mailed within 5 business days. For questions about membership, please call 772.223.7800. Comprehensive services from the Kane Center were made possible by an additional $150,000 contribution by the Joseph C. Day Foundation , which represents part of a total commitment of $500,000 to support the Council on Aging of Martin County.
